data.title: ‘From Here to Eternity’ at LACMA among upcoming movie screenings in the Los Angeles area
data.meta_description: Los Angeles, San Fernando Valley, Santa Monica areaHola Mexico Film Festival: Movies begin 5 p.m. May 20; 1 p.m. May 21. Check website for schedule and tickets. Regal LA Live Stadium 14 Theatre, 1000 W. Olympic Blvd., Los Angeles. www.holamexicoff.comAmerican Cinematheque at the Aero: “The Godfather” (1972) and “The Godfather Part II” (1974), 7:30 p.m. […]
data.text:
Los Angeles, San Fernando Valley, Santa Monica area

Hola Mexico Film Festival: Movies begin 5 p.m. May 20; 1 p.m. May 21. Check website for schedule and tickets. Regal LA Live Stadium 14 Theatre, 1000 W. Olympic Blvd., Los Angeles. www.holamexicoff.com

American Cinematheque at the Aero: “The Godfather” (1972) and “The Godfather Part II” (1974), 7:30 p.m. May 20. Human Rights Watch Film Series: “I Am Sun Mu” (2015), 5:30 p.m. May 22 ($15). Panel discussion follows. Cinematographer Douglas Slocombe: “Kind Hearts and Coronets” (1949) and “The Lavender Hill Mob” (1951), 7:30 p.m. May 26. “North by Northwest” (1959) and “To Catch a Thief” (1955), 7:30 p.m. May 27. Most tickets $11; $9 seniors and students. 1328 Montana Ave., Santa Monica. 323-466-3456. www.americancinematheque.com

American Cinematheque at the Egyptian Theatre: “Superstar” (1999), 7:30 p.m. May 20 (actress Molly Shannon is scheduled to attend). Art Deco Society Illustrated Lectures: Rosie Novellino-Mearns discusses Radio City Music Hall and signs her book “Saving Radio City Music Hall,” followed by “Cover Girl” (1944), 2 p.m. May 21. “Wild and Woolly” (1917) plus silent shorts, 7:30 p.m. May 21 (Spielberg Theatre). Art Directors Guild Film Society Series: “The Beloved Rogue” (1927), 5:30 p.m. May 22 (live musical accompaniment by Cliff Retallick). “Dead Slow Ahead” (2015), 7:30 p.m. May 22 (Spielberg). Influential Films Directed by Women: “Thirteen” (2013), 7:30 p.m. May 27 (Spielberg). Cinematographer Douglas Slocombe: “The Fearless Vampire Killers” (1967), “Scream of Fear” (1961) and “Circus of Horrors” (1960), 7:30 p.m. May 27. Most tickets $11; $9 seniors and students. 6712 Hollywood Blvd., Hollywood. 323-466-3456. www.americancinematheque.com

Beverly Cinema: “Sorcerer” (1977), 7:30 p.m. May 20-21; 6:30 p.m. May 22; 7:30 p.m. May 23. Most tickets $8. 7165 Beverly Blvd., Los Angeles. 323-938-4038. www.thenewbev.com

UCLA Film & Television Archive at the Billy Wilder Theater: Iranian Cinema: “Hadji Sha” (2014), 7:30 p.m. May 20; “Risk of Acid Rain” (2015) and “Fried Fish” (2014, animated short), 7:30 p.m. May 21; “Avalanche” (2015), 7 p.m. May 22. Independent Stardom Onscreen, Freelance Women in Hollywood: “To Be or Not to Be” (1942) and “In Name Only” (1939), 7:30 p.m. May 26. Tickets $10 online reserved; $9. Hammer Museum, 10899 Wilshire Blvd., Los Angeles. 310-206-3456. www.cinema.ucla.edu

Outdoor movie at the Skirball Cultural Center: “Field of Dreams” (1989), 8:30 p.m. May 20. Admission $10. 2701 N. Sepulveda Blvd., Los Angeles. 310-440-4500. www.skirball.org

Film Night at The Beachwood Cafe: Classic foreign film series: “Nosferatu” (1982), 7 p.m. May 21. Free movie with dinner (check website for menu). 2695 N. Beachwood Drive, Los Angeles. 323-871-1717. www.beachwoodcafe.com

Los Angeles Jewish Film Festival: Movies begin: 8 p.m. May 21; 10:30 a.m. May 22; 7 p.m. May 23; 12:30 p.m. May 24; 7:30 p.m. May 26. Check website for schedule, tickets and venues. www.lajfilmfest.org

Cinespia: Series of outdoor screenings at Hollywood Forever Cemetery. “The Silence of the Lambs” (1991), 8:30 p.m. May 21. Doors open, 6:45 p.m. Bring low-back chair or blanket for seating. Food trucks or bring your own picnic. No dogs. Check website for attendance rules and upcoming movies. Parking in three area lots $12-$15. Tickets $16. 6000 Santa Monica Blvd., Hollywood. www.cinespia.org

Cinefamily: Hangover Matinees: “Forbidden Planet” (1956), 1 p.m. May 22. Live DJ set and cocktails for sale, noon. Tickets $12. 611 N. Fairfax Ave., Los Angeles. 323-655-2510. www.cinefamily.org

Movie at Granada Hills Branch Library: “In the Heart of the Sea” (2015), 3:30 p.m. May 23. 10640 Petit Ave. 818-368-5687. www.lapl.org

Movie at the Skirball Cultural Center: “The True Cost” (2014, documentary), 7:30 p.m. May 24. Panel discussion. Tickets $10. 2701 N. Sepulveda Blvd., Los Angeles. 310-440-4500. www.skirball.org

Film at Los Angeles County Museum of Art: “From Here to Eternity” (1953), 1 p.m. May 24. Tickets $4. 5905 Wilshire Blvd., Los Angeles. 323-857-6010. www.lacma.com

Asian Pacific Heritage Month movie at Granada Hills Branch Library: “Three Seasons” (1999), 1:30 p.m. May 24. 10640 Petit Ave. 818-368-5687. www.lapl.org

Movie at Chatworth Branch Library: “Suffragette” (2015), 1:30 p.m. May 26. 21052 Devonshire St. 818-341-4276. www.laplchatsworthfriends.org

Live and Learn Documentary Series at Burbank Central Library: “Happy” (2011), 7 p.m. May 26. 110 N. Glenoaks Blvd. 818-238-5600. www.burbanklibrary.com

Eat See Hear: Series of outdoor screenings with live music and food trucks. “The Big Lebowski” (1998), 8:30 p.m. May 28. Doors open, 5:30 p.m. Music: Opus Orange, 7 p.m. Bring a low-back beach chair or blanket for seating. Tickets $15.76; $23.15 VIP. Check website for attendance rules. Autry Museum, 4700 Western Heritage Way, Los Angeles. www.eatseehear.com

Los Angeles Conservancy’s Last Remaining Seats: Movies show at vintage Los Angeles movie palaces (six movies available). “Top Gun” (1986), 2 and 8 p.m. June 4. Tickets $22 online only. Los Angeles Theatre, 615 S. Broadway. www.laconservancy.org/last-remaining-seats

Holly.Andres@langnews.com

Inland Valley area

Film at Fontana Lewis Library & Technology Center: “Yogi Bear” (2010), 6 p.m. May 19. 8437 Sierra Ave., Fontana. 909-349-6979. www.fontana.org

Film at UCR ARTSblock: “Court” (2014), 7 p.m. May 20; 7 p.m. May 21. Tickets $9.99; $5 students. 3834 Main St., Riverside. 951-827-3755. artsblock.edu

Elaine.Lehman@langnews.com

San Gabriel Valley area

Montebello Library: “American Experience: Zoot Suit Riots” (2001, PBS documentary), 2 p.m. May 19. 1550 W. Beverly Blvd. 323-722-6551. www.colapublib.org

Culture Vulture Monday at Laemmle: “Goya – Vision of Flesh and Blood” (2015, documentary), 7:30 p.m. May 23; 1 p.m. May 24. Tickets $15; $8 seniors. Locations: 450 W. Second St., Claremont; 673 E. Colorado Blvd., Pasadena. 310-478-3836. www.laemmle.com

Pasadena Central Library: “Stand and Deliver” (1988), 1 p.m. May 25. 285 E. Walnut St. 626-744-4066. www.pasadenapubliclibrary.net

Diamond Bar Library: “It Takes Two to Tango” (2014, in Mandarin with English subtitles), 1 p.m. May 28. A discussion follows screening. 21800 Coply Drive. 909-861-4978. www.colapublib.org

Linda.Gold@langnews.com

South Bay area

Old Town Music Hall: “On the Town” (1949), 8:15 p.m. May 20; 2:30 and 8:15 p.m. May 21. Shows begin with a sing-along with music played on a pipe organ and a comedy short. Tickets $10; $8 seniors (cash or check only). 140 Richmond St., El Segundo. 310-322-2592. www.oldtownmusichall.org

Sandy.Gerety@langnews.com
